result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis I. Thomas

11:26 Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Curtis I. Thomas in court.  Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Curtis I. Thomas. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: DE updates contact information with the Court. Attorney Olson is requesting an adjournment as the matter should be resolved with a DPA, but the State just needs additional time to draft the agreement. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant, Curtis I. Thomas, appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
No drug paraphenalia.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.

01:13 PM    Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brian Rolf.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 9/6/22 @930am. $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). ec
